title: Patti Smith Announces 50th Anniversary Horses Tour
description: Smith and her band will perform the landmark 1975 album in its entirety
author: Madison Bloom
excerpt: Smith and her band will perform the landmark 1975 album in its entirety
text: Patti Smith has announced a string of tour dates marking the 50th anniversary of her landmark debut Horses, Rolling Stone points out. Smith and her band will perform the album in its entirety each night of the tour. Smith will kick things off October 6 in Dublin, with concerts dotted around Europe and the UK before heading to the States in November. Patti Smith and her band will then perform in Seattle, Oakland, San Francisco, Chicago, New York, Boston, and Washington, D.C., with a final gig in Philadelphia on November 29. Find the full itinerary below.Joining Smith on stage will be longtime guitarist Lenny Kaye and drummer Jay Dee Daugherty, both of whom recorded with Smith on the 1975 LP. Smith’s live band will also feature bassist and Keyboardist Tony Shanahan, and guitarist Jackson Smith, Patti’s son. Smith has played Horses’ full tracklist a handful of times throughout the years, notably in 2015 at New York’s Beacon Theatre, and in 2005, at London’s Meltdown Festival, which she curated that year.Revisit “At 71 Years Old, Patti Smith Is Still a Rock Star—And Thank God for That” on the Pitch.All products featured on Pitchfork are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.Patti Smith and Her Band on the 50th Anniversary Perform HorsesPatti Smith:10-06 Dublin, Ireland - 3Arena10-08 Madrid, Spain - Teatro Real10-10 Bergamo, Italy - Chorus Life Arena10-12 London, England - The Palladium10-13 London, England - The Palladium10-15 Brussels, Belgium - Cirque Royale10-16 Brussels, Belgium - Cirque Royale10-18 Oslo, Norway - Sentrum Scene10-20 Paris, France - The Olympia10-21 Paris, France - The Olympia11-10 Seattle, WA - The Paramount Theatre11-12 Oakland, CA - The Fox Theatre11-13 San Francisco, CA - The Masonic11-15 Los Angeles, CA - Walt Disney Concert Hall11-17 Chicago, IL - The Chicago Theatre11-21 New York, NY - The Beacon11-22 New York, NY - The Beacon11-24 Boston, MA - The Orpheum Theatre11-28 Washington, DC - The Anthem11-29 Philadelphia, PA - The MetCorrection: An earlier version of this story incorrectly stated that Patti Smith hadn’t performed Horses in full since 2005. It has been updated to also mention her performance of the LP at New York’s Beacon Theatre in 2015.This article was originally published on Tuesday, February 11 at 2:58 p.m. Eastern. It was last updated on February 11 at 359 p.m. Eastern.
html:
Patti Smith has announced a string of tour dates marking the 50th anniversary of her landmark debut Horses, Rolling Stone points out. Smith and her band will perform the album in its entirety each night of the tour. Smith will kick things off October 6 in Dublin, with concerts dotted around Europe and the UK before heading to the States in November. Patti Smith and her band will then perform in Seattle, Oakland, San Francisco, Chicago, New York, Boston, and Washington, D.C., with a final gig in Philadelphia on November 29. Find the full itinerary below.

Joining Smith on stage will be longtime guitarist Lenny Kaye and drummer Jay Dee Daugherty, both of whom recorded with Smith on the 1975 LP. Smith’s live band will also feature bassist and Keyboardist Tony Shanahan, and guitarist Jackson Smith, Patti’s son. Smith has played Horses’ full tracklist a handful of times throughout the years, notably in 2015 at New York’s Beacon Theatre, and in 2005, at London’s Meltdown Festival, which she curated that year.

Revisit “At 71 Years Old, Patti Smith Is Still a Rock Star—And Thank God for That” on the Pitch.

All products featured on Pitchfork are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.

Patti Smith and Her Band on the 50th Anniversary Perform Horses

Patti Smith:

10-06 Dublin, Ireland - 3Arena
10-08 Madrid, Spain - Teatro Real
10-10 Bergamo, Italy - Chorus Life Arena
10-12 London, England - The Palladium
10-13 London, England - The Palladium
10-15 Brussels, Belgium - Cirque Royale
10-16 Brussels, Belgium - Cirque Royale
10-18 Oslo, Norway - Sentrum Scene
10-20 Paris, France - The Olympia
10-21 Paris, France - The Olympia
11-10 Seattle, WA - The Paramount Theatre
11-12 Oakland, CA - The Fox Theatre
11-13 San Francisco, CA - The Masonic
11-15 Los Angeles, CA - Walt Disney Concert Hall
11-17 Chicago, IL - The Chicago Theatre
11-21 New York, NY - The Beacon
11-22 New York, NY - The Beacon
11-24 Boston, MA - The Orpheum Theatre
11-28 Washington, DC - The Anthem
11-29 Philadelphia, PA - The Met

Correction: An earlier version of this story incorrectly stated that Patti Smith hadn’t performed Horses in full since 2005. It has been updated to also mention her performance of the LP at New York’s Beacon Theatre in 2015.

This article was originally published on Tuesday, February 11 at 2:58 p.m. Eastern. It was last updated on February 11 at 359 p.m. Eastern.
